definition: variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
Kevin Rudd (1957-), Australian politician, proficient in Mandarin, prime minister 2007-2010 and 2013

sentences.english: Last Saturday, Kevin put things in boxes all day. He went to bed very late that night.
sentences.chinese: 上星期日，克文整天放东西到箱子里，他那晚很晚睡。

sentences.english: Kevin, there are a lot of things in this room. Are they all yours?
sentences.chinese: 克文，这房间里有许多东西，它们全部都是你的吗？

definition: elderly man/father/father-in-law/neck feathers of a bird (old)
surname Jiang/refers to Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
surname Zhu/abbr. for 天竺[Tian1 zhu2] India (esp. in Tang or Buddhist context)/Buddhism (archaic)
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself
Wen Kang (mid-19th century), Manchu-born novelist, author of The Gallant Maid 兒女英雄傳|儿女英雄传[Er2 nu:3 Ying1 xiong2 Zhuan4]
lost/missing/forsaken/dissolute/(of a woman) beautiful/fault/offense/hermit/variant of 逸[yi4]
